00100     void setMode(GuiMode newMode)
00101     {
00102       if (newMode==GM_Inventory && allowed==GW_None)
00103         return;
00104 
00105       mode = newMode;
00106       updateVisible();
00107     }
00108     void setNextMode(GuiMode newMode);
00109 
00110     GuiMode getMode() const { return mode; }
00111 
00112     bool isGuiMode() const { return getMode() != GM_Game; } // Everything that is not game mode is considered "gui mode"
00113 
00114     // Disallow all inventory mode windows
00115     void disallowAll()
00116     {
00117       allowed = GW_None;
00118       updateVisible();
00119     }
00120 
00121     // Allow one or more windows
00122     void allow(GuiWindow wnd)
00123     {
00124       allowed = (GuiWindow)(allowed | wnd);
00125       updateVisible();
00126     }
00127

00228     /* Currently ALLOWED windows in inventory mode. This is used at
00229        the start of the game, when windows are enabled one by one
00230        through script commands. You can manipulate this through using
00231        allow() and disableAll().
00232 
00233        The setting should also affect visibility of certain HUD
00234        elements, but this is not done yet.
00235      */

00248   template<typename T>
00249   void WindowManager::removeDialog(T*& dialog)
00250   {
00251       OEngine::GUI::Layout *d = static_cast<OEngine::GUI::Layout*>(dialog);
00252       removeDialog(d);
00253       dialog = 0;
00254   }
